caption.p: NK cell depletion in vaccinated, influenza-challenged mice increases lung CD3+ T cell and neutrophil infiltration. Four days post infection in the model described in Figure 2A, whole lungs were excised and single cells isolated for flow cytometry. Proportion (%) of (A) CD3+ T cells, (B) CD3+CD4+ and CD3+CD8+ T cells, and (C) active (CD69+) CD3+ T cells, as determined from singlet, live lung leukocytes. Proportion (%) of (B) CD19+ B cells, (C) Ly6C-high inflammatory monocytes, and (D) Ly6G+ neutrophils. Data in (A) from males {M} ( n = 7–14/group) is compiled from three independent experiments and data in (B–F) from males {M} ( n = 7–10/group) is compiled from two independent experiments, with each independent experimental data shown in Figure S9. Dots represent individual mice, with bar representing mean. Significance determined by Mann-Whitney U test, ns, not significant.
